ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Bilateral sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Audiometric testing reveals a bilateral, generally mild, sloping sensorineural hearing loss with normal middle ear function.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To determine the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To assess the integrity of the retrocochlear pathway.
To quantify the patient's difficulty hearing in background noise (QuickSIN).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with bilateral, generally mild, sloping sensorineural hearing loss. Word recognition in quiet is excellent. Middle ear function is normal.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Slight SNHL 250-3000 Hz, sloping to mild at 4000 Hz. Left ear: Normal to slight SNHL 250-2000 Hz, sloping to moderate at 6000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs (25 dB HL AU) consistent with pure tones. WRS excellent (96% AD, 100% AS).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal ear canal volume, static compliance, and middle ear pressure bilaterally (Type A).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Present and normal for ipsilateral and contralateral stimulation at 500-4000 Hz. Decay negative.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Unaided QuickSIN testing performed prior to fitting reveals a severe signal-to-noise ratio loss, correlating with the patient's chief complaint.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: QuickSIN unaided SNR loss average 18.17 dB, indicating severe SNR loss.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Aided QuickSIN testing at the 2-week follow-up reveals significant improvement.

tests.name: Speech-in-noise
tests.result_summary: Aided QuickSIN SNR loss of 2.98 dB (mild), representing a 15.19 dB improvement over the unaided score.

proposed_items: Hearing Assistive Technology (HAT) such as amplified phones and TV ears (recommended)
counseling_actions: Counseling on hearing loss and realistic expectations
Recommendation for hearing protection in noise
Instruction on hearing aid use, insertion/removal, batteries, and iPhone application
Discussion of tinnitus management through amplification

escalation.rationale_short: Patient requires routine follow-up for hearing aid checks and annual monitoring.

follow_up_plan.objective: Follow-up to check hearing aid benefit, satisfaction, and perform aided validation measures.

expected_outcome: Aided QuickSIN: Significant improvement noted with an SNR loss of 2.98 dB (mild), representing a 15.19 dB improvement over the unaided score of 18.17 dB (severe).
Washington University Self-Assessment Scale: Demonstrated improvement in all categories (Single Talker, Telephone, Multi-Talker, Entertainment Device) with hearing aids compared to unaided baseline.
Patient reported doing well with hearing aids, satisfied with overall results, and doing significantly better in noise.
